intro: Rhinanthus hayekii, commonly known as the Hayek's yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Rhinanthus hayekii plays a role in supporting pollinators and is considered a rare species in many regions.
